experiments.hypothesis: The 'Fairness' axis may measure system legitimacy rather than abstract fairness
experiments.method: Compared projections of statements that disambiguate fairness sentiment from system stance
experiments.conclusion: AXIS SHOWS MIXED/ENTANGLED MEASUREMENT. The axis conflates fairness with system legitimacy. Both concepts are entangled in the embedding space.

experiments.hypothesis: Semantically equivalent paraphrases should project to similar locations
experiments.method: Projected groups of paraphrased statements and measured within-group variance
experiments.conclusion: Paraphrase robustness is LOW. Average spread=0.926, Mode consistency=0/4

experiments.hypothesis: Mode classifications near boundaries should show appropriate uncertainty
experiments.method: Analyzed probability gaps and confidence for ambiguous statements
experiments.conclusion: Mode boundary sensitivity is HIGH (many borderline cases). Avg prob gap=11.90%, Avg confidence=0.37

experiments.hypothesis: Manipulating one axis should not significantly affect others
experiments.method: Applied targeted linguistic manipulations and measured cross-axis effects
experiments.conclusion: Axes are PARTIALLY DISENTANGLED. Average manipulation specificity: 66.3%

experiments.hypothesis: Projections should be stable under meaning-preserving perturbations
experiments.method: Applied 6 types of perturbations and measured projection stability
experiments.conclusion: Projection shows MODERATE ROBUSTNESS. Avg score=0.698, Mode flip rate=43.2%

findings: [axis_validity_fairness] AXIS SHOWS MIXED/ENTANGLED MEASUREMENT. The axis conflates fairness with system legitimacy. Both concepts are entangled in the embedding space. (confidence: 60%)
[paraphrase_robustness] Paraphrase robustness is LOW. Average spread=0.926, Mode consistency=0/4 (confidence: 40%)
[mode_boundary_sensitivity] Mode boundary sensitivity is HIGH (many borderline cases). Avg prob gap=11.90%, Avg confidence=0.37 (confidence: 70%)
[axis_disentanglement] Axes are PARTIALLY DISENTANGLED. Average manipulation specificity: 66.3% (confidence: 60%)
[adversarial_robustness] Projection shows MODERATE ROBUSTNESS. Avg score=0.698, Mode flip rate=43.2% (confidence: 75%)
recommendations: 1. Consider renaming 'Fairness' axis to 'System Legitimacy' if validation confirms conflation
2. Add confidence intervals to all projections using ensemble methods
3. Report mode classification confidence alongside discrete labels
4. Expand training data beyond 64 examples to improve robustness
5. Consider disentanglement training to reduce axis correlations
6. Add paraphrase augmentation to training data for stability
